benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: PUT /1.0/kb/invoiceItems/{invoiceItemId}/customFields - Modify custom fields to invoice item

covered: Valid Request: Multiple scenarios (TC01-TC05) cover successful updates with valid payload and headers.
Authorization: TC13 covers unauthorized access scenarios.

Error Handling and Validation: TC06, TC08, TC09, TC10, TC11, TC12, TC14 cover invalid IDs, malformed payloads, missing headers, empty bodies, unsupported fields, large payloads, and SQL injection attempts.
Non-Existing and State Variations: TC07, TC24, TC25 cover 404 for non-existent items and various database state scenarios.
Server and Dependency Failures: TC15 (500), TC16 (504), TC19 (503) cover internal/system errors and dependent service unavailability.
Resilience and Quality: TC17 (idempotency) and TC18 (regression) provide stability checks, and TC20-TC21 address performance considerations.
Edge Cases: TC22 and TC23 exercise minimum values and URL parameter edge cases.
gaps: Concurrency/Race Conditions: No tests simulate concurrent updates to the same invoice item.
Partial Update Semantics: No explicit tests validating rejection of partial updates if not allowed.
Rate Limiting/Throttling: No tests for handling bursts or throttling of PUT requests.
Caching Behavior: No tests validating caching headers or ETag semantics for PUT operations.
Data-Type Validation inside CustomField: No tests specifically validating data types within custom field values.
Role-Based Authorization beyond test_user: No varied role-based tests.
recommendations: Add a dedicated concurrency test to simulate two clients updating the same invoice item simultaneously.
Add partial-update validation tests if API does not support partial updates.
Introduce rate-limiting tests to verify throttling behavior and proper error handling.
Add tests around caching behavior and ETag/Cache-Control headers for PUT responses where applicable.
Add data-type validation tests for fields inside CustomField objects (e.g., numeric vs string).
Add tests for role-based authorization with different user roles/tokens to ensure proper access control.
